titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Harold Stirling Vanderbilt Papers

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

repository.corpname: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

userestrict.p: The Harold Stirling Vanderbilt Collection consists of material transferred to Vanderbilt University from the Manalapan, Florida, estate after the death of Vanderbilt's widow, Gertrude Conaway Vanderbilt. The collection spans the years from approximately 1910 to 1978. It contains linear feet of material, largely comprised of correspondence and scrapbooks on contract bridge, yacht racing, and Vanderbilt University.

The collection covers only certain aspects of Harold Vanderbilt's life. It contains little personal correspondence and almost no material on his business affairs, such as his long-term interest in the New York Central Railroad.

Several hundred photographs contained in the collection will be processed and maintained in the Vanderbilt University Photographic Archive. This collection includes photographs from Vanderbilt's childhood, cruises, races; of his family, friends, residences, yachts, and airplanes. Over one third of the photographs are of Gertrude Conaway, her childhood and family. It is a fine depiction of turn-of-the-century costume and customs of the wealthy.

chronitem.event: Harold S. Vanderbilt born to William Kissam Vanderbilt and Alva Erskine Smith (later Mrs. O.H.P. Belmont) at Oakdale, N.Y.
Vanderbilt graduated from St. Mark's School, Southborough, Massachusetts. First race, on the RELIANCE.
Cruise on the VAGRANT. Won the Bermuda Race. West Indies Cruise. 1917 - Patrolled waters from London to Nantucket for the U.S. Navy.
Won the Astor Cup; King's Cup.
Successfully defended the America's Cup against Britain's Sir Thomas Lupton, ENTERPRISE vs. SHAMROCK V
Vanderbilt married Gertrude Conaway in New York.
Defended the America's Cup against Britain's T.O.M. Sopwith, RAINBOW vs. ENDEAVOR
Astor Cup. 1937 - America's Cup, RANGER vs. ENDEAVOR II. 1942 - Started farming in Virginia.
Elected to the Board of Trust, Vanderbilt University.
Became President of the Board of Trust. 1967 - Financed the America's Cup defender INTREPID. Retired as President of the Board of Trust.

Scrapbooks, 1930 America's Cup Race Five boxes of photographs were removed to the Photographic Archive. These consisted of family snapshots, portraits, old scrapbooks of the Vanderbilt and Conaway families, Yachts, airplanes, Vanderbilt University.
